Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 7th overall pick, by Cleveland in 1970...
Traded from Cleveland to Chicago (A) on 2/13/1970 (Going to CHW: RF O. Velez. Going to CLE: LF H. Speed)...
Had first career hit (double) on 6/12/1976, off Ron Guidry (MIN)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/12/1976, off Ron Guidry (MIN)...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/4/1976, hitting .591 with 2 HR, 4 RBI...
Won Gold Glove Award at Rightfield in 1980...
Signed as a free agent by Texas on 2/13/1982 to a 1-year deal worth $1,000,000 per year...
Injured on 6/17/1982 with a Bruised Ulna, out for 1-2 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by Texas on 2/11/1983 to a 1-year deal worth $1,000,000 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Texas on 2/18/1984 to a 1-year deal worth $1,000,000 per year...
Drafted in 5th round, 86th overall pick, by Los Angeles in 1987...
Injured on 6/5/1989 with a Tight Shoulder, out for one week...
Injured on 9/5/1989 with a Strained Hamstring Muscle, out for 2-3 weeks...
Injured on 7/27/1990 with a Sore Shoulder, out for 5 days...
Injured on 8/17/1991 with a Broken Knee, out for full season...
Had first career hit on 4/4/1993, off Chuck McElroy (NYM)...
